avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes large wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. These can be released by a single winter sport participant.
As a consequence of solar radiation dry and moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even quite large ones. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some regions 40 to 60 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday above approximately 2000 m.
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a resilient melt-freeze crust. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Along the border with Switzerland and adjacent to ridgelines the avalanche danger is one level higher.
In the last two days sometimes large wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. These can be released, even by small loads in isolated cases, especially on wind-loaded slopes. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
As a consequence of solar radiation small and medium-sized dry and moist avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on rocky sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area up to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday above approximately 2000 m.
The moderate wind has transported the new snow. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a resilient melt-freeze crust.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls mostly small wind slabs formed. Caution is to be exercised in particular in extremely steep shady starting zones at high altitude. Even a small avalanche can sweep snow sport participants along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday above approximately 2000 m.
The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
